resources.string: Device has been already registered in GCM
Failed to register your device, please try later
Failed to unregister your device, please try later

It looks like your device does not has linked Google account. Please register your device with Google in order to use \"How Is My Phone Doing App\". The application will automatically exist when you tap OK
Device is Registered in Google cloud
Device is not Registered in Google cloud
How Is My Phone Doing Admin
Device administration for better performance and better phone battery.
By enabling anti-theft feature you\'re can control security sensitive data of you device remotely such as change device password, or erase all the data or lock the device and etc.
By disabling this you won\'t be able to perform AntiTheft features of How Is my Phone Doing App remotely from a web site. You can always enable it back from the app.

PLEASE READ THIS FIRST!!!
How to delete the application? Below instructions about how to delete this application.
  • If you decided to enable AntiTheft feature and set this application [How Is My Phone Doing?] as Active Device Administrator, then before deleting it you should first remove [How Is My Phone Doing?] app from the list of device administrators: Settings-> Security -> Device Administrators -> Uncheck checkbox next to [How Is My Phone Doing?] app
    After that you can remove application regular way you do it on your device
  • If you did not enable AntiTheft feature you can remove the application the same way as you remove any other application on your device
How to use this application?
  • After launching this application go to %1$s
  • Log in on web site your google plus account
  • Make sure that you use the same account to log in on %1$s and on your android device
  • Right after logging in to %1$s the application automatically will start search for your devices. The location detection is slow process and sometimes may take long time. If you realize that your device(s) can not be found for long period of time, click Update Devices Location button to force location detection to be executed again
  • To send message click on Send message button, fill in all the required fields and click Send message button inside appeared window
  • To see device status information and update device settings, or use AntiTheft feature click My Devices(*) button and select device you want to check in left list panel
Why I can not see any devices on %1$s? There are several reasons why you may not see your device on %1$s website. If you don\'t see any devices on %1$s, please try doing following:
  • Make sure that you android device has access to the internet
  • Make sure that after closing whit window you see green label at the top of the screen saying that %2$s
    • If you see %3$s that means there is a problem registering device into Google Cloud Messaging system. To fix this please try to restart the application. If restarting the application does not help, please send the problem description to ioanbsu@gmail.com
  • Check that google account name that you\'ve logged in with to %1$s (displayed at the top right corner in %1$s) the same as your google account name that you use ont you android device. To check the google account name that is used on your device, please close this window and read the text in green at the top of you device\'s screen. it will have information about what account is used by [How Is My Phone Doing?] app
  • Try to refresh %1$s website
  • If nothing described above helped, please contact the application owner with detailed problem description at ioanbsu@gmail.com
Why am I always seeing this message when I start the application?
  • People tend to think that this application is a virus because after enabling AntiTheft feature they can not delete the application. Well this is not true, the reason why this application can not be removed once the AntiTheft feature is enabled is because of Android OS policies. Once the AntiTheft feature enabled the [How Is My Phone Doing?] app marked as device administering app. According to Android OS policies it is impossible to remove device administering applications from Android OS. So to remove this app it should we first unchecked as device administering app. After that it can be easily removed.
  • Main purpose of this application is to provide control of your phone/tablet from the web site %1$s The [How is My Phone Doing?] application should be started only once to register itself in Google Cloud Messaging system. And after that there is no sense of starting and stopping this application - it is already registered in cloud and can be controlled from the website %1$s . The only reason to open this application would be to see instructions that are displayed in this popup.

You had enabled AntiTheft feature on you device. That means you will be able to wipe out you phone\\tablet remotely(when it stolen) or lock the screen with new pin code that you enter on ioanbsu.com. Also Beware, that by enabling AntiTheft feature you marked [How Is My Phone Doing?] application as administrative application for you device. That means that you won\'t be able to remove [How Is My Phone Doing?] application from your device unless you remove administrative rights from [How Is My Phone Doing?] app. You can do so in your device\'s settings.
You can open now https://ioanbsu.com on your computer\'s favorite browser to control your device online. Log in using the same Google account name that you use on this device: %1$ss
